chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo Gaytan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession Of A Firearm on Grounds of a School, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.605(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: The Court granted huber privileges for work and school.

miscConds.notes: No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attend any counseling deemed appropriate by the Department.
Complete anger management course.
Complete restorative justice program.
Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by the end of supervision.
Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

On August 11, 2022:  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: STAYED and to be used at the Department's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Gaytan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Ricardo Gaytan.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges work and school.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Court ordered 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED and to be used at the department's discretion. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
- Obtain HSD, HSED, or GED.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 60 hours of community service. 
- Attend any counseling deemed appropriate by the department. 
- Complete anger management course.
- Complete restorative justice program. 

*Court allows for expungement if the defendant successfully completes probation. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay mandatory all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearms and voting warnings given.

Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a final pre-trial.  However, parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS 2 AND 3 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Court vacated jury trial scheduled on August 29, 2022.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Requested Jury Instructions

Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense request an adjournment as parties are in negotiations. Case adjourned, branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court in person with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg who appears by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer B. Cervantes.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Ricardo Gaytan in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ricardo Gaytan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY As to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
